intro: Laxoplumeria, commonly known as the flame tree, is a tropical plant characterized by its striking, fiery orange to red flowers that bloom in dense clusters. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is native to Central and South America. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces long, pendulous inflorescences that are highly visible during the flowering season. Laxoplumeria thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
